summary: “Come cuddle.” (Carol Danvers x reader)
body:
“Come cuddle.” (Carol Danvers x reader)

You and Carol spend the evening together after a tiring day. Nothing angsty, just pure fluff.

This is my first piece of writing in months, so please be kind! I’m still trying to get back into the swing of it, so feel free to send me requests.

I also posted this to my ao3, so perhaps leave me some feedback or kudos on there too? It’s much appreciated <3

Stumbling into the hallway, you carelessly slammed the door behind you and let out a sigh of relief. It had been yet another long, tiresome day at work, and the bus rolling up almost forty minutes late did nothing to improve your lousy mood. Tugging off your jacket, you trudged into the lounge where Carol was curled up on the couch, the chalky white blanket you bought as last year’s Christmas gift wrapped around her shoulders. She had been avidly watching a game show on the television screen in front of her but after hearing the sound of your footsteps, she tilted her head towards you and gave a warm smile.

“Hey, sweetie. Bad day?”

You nodded, tossing your jacket onto the back of the couch. “So many people testing my patience today. I almost broke down into tears in the bathroom during my shift.”

Carol held out her arms. “Come cuddle,” she said gently.

You sat down on the couch as Carol shifted along to give you space. Kicking off your shoes, you tucked your feet behind you as Carol wrapped her arms around you, bringing you closer. A soft kiss was placed on your head and you allowed yourself to relax for the first time that day as you leaned in to your girlfriend’s warm touch.

“Want to talk about it?” she asked, carefully running her hands through your hair.

“Not really,” you mumbled. “Just need to be here with you.”

You laid your head on her chest and closed your eyes, feeling her steady heartbeat against your cheek. Carol slipped her hand into yours, lightly stroking your fingers.

“Hey, guess what.”

You looked up, watching a playful smile appear on her face. “What?” you grinned.

“I bought you something today. Thought you might like it.”

Carol reached behind the couch and pulled out a box of cookies, adorned with a dainty pink ribbon. “Monica had these the other week and shared them with me. I was gonna bring some home for you but we finished the lot.”

A warmth spread across your cheeks. “You’re too kind. Thank you, honey.”

Carol beamed. “Glad it cheered you up.”

You carefully pulled the ribbon, unravelling it slowly. Lifting the lid, you set your eyes on the various gaps in the box where a number of cookies appeared to be missing.

“How many of these have you eaten already?” you laughed, turning to Carol. She ducked her head down, trying to hide her smirk.

“I might’ve opened the box before you got home,” she replied, fiddling with her hands. “I couldn’t help it.”

You giggled in response, setting the box aside and lifting her face to meet yours. “I appreciate the thought.”

Carol smiled once more, her eyes bright as she gazed at you with adoration. Leaning in, you brought your lips to hers in a tender kiss, feeling the familiar sensation of butterflies spread through your stomach. Hands clasped together, you could stay in this moment for hours.

“I love you,” you murmured, gently brushing your fingers against Carol’s cheek.

“I love you too.”

summary: Mystery Woman (Synopsis)
body:
Mystery Woman (Synopsis)

Y/N L/N is a famous Instagram cosplayer and has been since 2014 when she first started. She has a best friend, Riley Peterson, who also does cosplay. Together they’re celebrities among the cosplay community. They attend every con they can and have met thousands of people, including some of the actors they’ve cosplayed as.

Y/N, known disaster bisexual, has the most massive crush on Brie Larson and Captain Marvel ever possible. So much so that she keeps her cosplay of said Captain a secret until Comic Con 2019, when she knows Brie will be there.

When Brie sees Y/N, she is floored. She immediately takes to Twitter to find the woman she’s fallen head over heels for. Their worlds collide and they start a whirlwind romance that takes the Internet by storm.

(I would like to say that I am NOT saying that Brie is a lesbian/bisexual/pan/any other variation on the LGBTQA+ community. I am not forcing this in her face and trying to convince people that she is gay. If she is, cool! Good for her! If she’s not, alright! That’s totally chill! This is just a fictional story and I did it for fun because I really love Brie. If you want to think about it like this, I’m just using Brie as a “face claim” for my social media au. Pls don’t attack me, I’m sensitive as hell :,) )

summary: Rotten Tomatoes attempts to fix review bombing with ticket verification
title: Rotten Tomatoes attempts to fix review bombing with ticket verification
description:
Users are now required to verify that they’ve purchased a ticket to a film before being allowed to review a film on the site and contribute to a film’s aggregate “audience score.”

Review bombing is when a group bombards any media with negative scores in hopes that the media will perform poorer as a result. When it comes to film, review bombing usually occurs as a protest of a movie featuring a person of color or women in a lead role. The tactic first saw widespread use when The Last Jedi released in 2017. Users utilized negative scores to protest Asian-American actress, Kelly Marie Tran’s inclusion as Rose Tico in the film. More recently, Marvel Cinematic Universe films like Black Panther and Captain Marvel have been subjected to review bombs.

Starting on Thursday, the site will be working with Fandango, AMC Theaters, Regal Cinemas, and Cinemark to verify that users reviewing films have actually seen the film. Users who have verified their tickets will be denoted with a “verified” mark on the top of their review.

Users who don’t verify their tickets can still leave reviews and score the film. The non-verified reviews won’t be shown or tailed into the overall audience score under the sites default setting. Users who wish to see a composite of verified and unverified reviews can click “more info” to unlock the “all audience” option.

blog.name: behind-evil-thoughts
blog.title: This type of thinking could do us in
blog.description:
Sarah 
| 22 | Canadian | Libra | Works in Film and Television

summary: Wow
title: Wow
body:
Honestly the more I think about Captain Marvel the more it has really grown on me and I can’t wait to see it again (and her scenes in Endgame again)

Look at her!! She’s so cute!

It’s also so refreshing to see a female superhero being excited like this and not just acting stoic and unemotional all the time?? I love love love how expressive she is and how she acts like a real person!!!

In short, my Bi heart can’t handle Carol Danvers.

summary: Idea for the opening to “Captain Marvel 2″
title: Idea for the opening to “Captain Marvel 2″
body:
We start off around the time Carol Danvers brought Tony and Nebula back to Earth. While Tony recovers from his stab wound, Carol is seen looking through the Internet, learning all she can about what happened on Earth since she left. Natasha Romanoff (cameo appearance by Scarlett Johansson) walks up to Carol and asks what she’s been doing for the last two decades. Through this, we learn that Carol never came back to Earth after leaving to help the Skrulls find a new homeworld. Carol coldly says, “that’s none of your concern” and walks away.

Time jump to a few days after “Endgame”. Carol visits the Rambeau family home and we see that it’s been long abandoned. As she’s inspecting the house, a group of Skrull soldiers arrive, led by the Super-Skrull making his MCU debut (his origins will be explored in a Fantastic Four movie). Super-Skrull says that Carol broke her promise to both the Kree and the Skrulls by returning to Earth, once in 2018 to save Tony Stark and Nebula, and then again in 2023 to fight Thanos. Through this, we learn that Carol was banned/exiled. 

Carol says she had to come back to Earth in order to save the universe, despite knowing that by doing so, she’d be punished. The Skrulls, despite respecting her for what she did for their people and understanding that Thanos needed to be defeated, says that she still has to pay for breaking her promise.

A fight occurs and Carol reluctantly battles the Skrulls. The fight ends with Carol getting stabbed in the back by the Super-Skrull, who says to her, “this isn’t personal”. The Skrulls then leave her to bleed to death. As she’s passing out from blood loss, a group of civilians arrive and try to save her. She then starts hallucinating the civilians as her loved ones and we get another look at Carol’s state of mind through how her hallucinations speak to her.

1) The Talos hallucination says he’s grateful for what she did for his people and that he’s sorry that future generations of the Skrulls let her down. He says that there are no clear heroes or villains in war and he’s sorry that Carol had to learn that the hard way during the Kree-Skrull War. 

2) The Maria Rambeau and Monica Rambeau hallucinations are angry that Carol left them and never came back home.  

3) The Nick Fury hallucination says to Carol that the superhero life requires sacrifice and that she was foolish for thinking she could end the Kree-Skrull War without sacrificing something important to her (hinting at the reason why she was exiled from Earth).

When the hallucinations disappear, the screen starts to fade to black as Carol blacks out from blood loss. Cue Marvel opening logo.

When we come back to the movie, we’re in space. The year is “2000″, five years after the events of the first Captain Marvel. The rest of the movie is an extended flashback to Carol ending the Kree-Skrull War and revealing the reason why Carol was banned from returning to Earth. 

BONUS: At the end of the movie, we come back to present day, where we see Carol recovering in the hospital. Nick Fury is there and Carol talks about what happened in the past and the reasons why she never came home. Fury says, “Thank you for telling me…but I’m not the one who needs to hear this”, leading to Maria and Monica Rambeau (now an adult) entering the room. Movie ends with them reconciling and burying the past.

reblog.comment:
We start off around the time Carol Danvers brought Tony and Nebula back to Earth. While Tony recovers from his stab wound, Carol is seen looking through the Internet, learning all she can about what happened on Earth since she left. Natasha Romanoff (cameo appearance by Scarlett Johansson) walks up to Carol and asks what she’s been doing for the last two decades. Through this, we learn that Carol never came back to Earth after leaving to help the Skrulls find a new homeworld. Carol coldly says, “that’s none of your concern” and walks away.

Time jump to a few days after “Endgame”. Carol visits the Rambeau family home and we see that it’s been long abandoned. summary: Clarkisha Thee Billy Goat on Twitter
body:
Clarkisha Thee Billy Goat on Twitter

“You mean the nigga who needed six ROCKS to do his dirty work because he got tired of planet-hopping like Ms. Frizzle & capping niggas the old-fashioned way? You mean the nigga who needed another ROCK to engage in versus combat w/ my good sis Carol? That wack ass nigga? Chile…”

“Wack ass nigga. Mans headbutted Carol and she smirked at that ass with her fresh lesbian haircut INTACT. Y’all are delusional.”

This whole thread and its replies have been amazing. My skin is clear, my crops have been watered, and my laundry has been folder.

Don’t bring that mess about Carol (and Wanda) not being the strongest Avengers.
